item.title: Job at VATEUD.
item.description: Starting into the Staff Job at VATEUD.
item.content:encoded:
Since the end of January this year I have been working on a voluntary basis at VATEUD (short for VATSIM Europe Division) and thus not only supported the VATSIM network as a pilot and ATCo but also as an active staff member in the European Division.

Whats my Jobâ€‹

I applied and was accepted for the Staff position in the VATEUD Event Team or in the Event Management area. I report to the Community Department and the Community Director.

As Event Manager I have the following tasks:

  • Elaborate events
  • Represented the European Division in CTL's planning efforts
  • Creating event banners
  • Overseeing of the vACC Event Teams
  • Supporting the Community Department and Director

My goalsâ€‹

My main goals at VATEUD are to integrate new members and to bring smaller airports and FIRs onto the "big stage".

Furthermore, I would like to incorporate the feedback of the vACC teams into my planning as much as possible.

Closing Wordsâ€‹

You made it ðŸ¥³ Thanks for reading until the next blog post ðŸ‘‹
item.author: laurin@stapfl.net (Laurino)

item.title: Hello, world.
item.description: When it comes to social media, I'm definitely more a reader than a writer type of person.
item.content:encoded:
When it comes to social media, I'm definitely more a reader than a writer type of person. Recently I've felt a need to start creating content. Or, more like get back into doing it.

Actually i never had a blog so yeah why not to start one yet?

Why yet another blogâ€‹

Nowadays, everyone has their own blog. Do I really need to become another wannabe influencer?

No. What I want to achieve is:

  • structure my knowledge and record what I've learned recently,
  • try out new ways to increase productivity, stay motivated and avoid burnout,
  • improve my English (as a non-native English speaker),
  • develop self-discipline, reduce procrastination, and, as a result, save time to do the things mentioned above.

So, as you can see, it's mostly for me, but I hope you'll benefit from this as well.

What to expectâ€‹

Well, definitely shorter, more concise blog posts, like this one.

source: tenor

While I have a few ideas for new blog posts in mind, I don't want to limit myself to just technical topics. Instead, I will probably touch on different areas of my interest, such as:

  • full-stack technical topics related to the technologies I use
  • personal projects announcements,
  • new talks announcements
  • open source,
  • cool projects and apps I stumbled upon,
  • productivity,
  • personal growth (i.e. soft skills),

Yup, that's a lot - but we'll see how it goes.

Closing Wordsâ€‹

If you got to this point, then congratulations. ðŸŽ‰ Welcome to my blog.

Thanks for reading see you and bye ðŸ‘‹
item.author: laurin@stapfl.net (Laurino)
